Package textanalyzer

Class TextAnalyzer

java.lang.Object
textanalyzer.TextAnalyzer
public class TextAnalyzer
extends java.lang.Object
TextAnalyzer class is used to carry out the tasks that are meant to read a HTML document, select only the words that appear in the poem included in that HTML file (ignoring HTML tags), and display all the words together with a number that represent the times each word "occurs" in the poem "The Raven" by E. Poe
Version:
1.0
Author:
octavian
See Also:
ArrayList, File, Scanner

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static int occurrenceCounter
    It is used to count how many times a words occur in the file provided

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    TextAnalyzer()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> cleanArrayNoTags​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> someArray)
    Removes the HTML tags from the file that is read within the TextAnalyzer class.
    static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> fileManager()
    By using a Scanner object, it reads a HTML file, looks for the beginning of the poem, then reads all the words in the poem, ignores the HTML tags, and stops after the last word of the poem
    static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
    This is the main method of TextAnalyzer class that calls trimPunctuation() methods, creates an instance of the PairOfWordsAndOccurrences class, and sorts the pairs of words and occurrences by the occurrence in descendant order
    static java.lang.String[] removeAmpersand​(java.lang.String initialStr)
    Takes the words that contains dashes, represented in HTML with an expression that include the ampersand.
    static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> trimPunctuation​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> beginingArray)
    As some of the words in the poem are ended with punctuation signs, this method removes all the final punctuation that exists at the end of any word that is in this situation

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • occurrenceCounter

      public static int occurrenceCounter
      It is used to count how many times a words occur in the file provided

  • Constructor Details

    • TextAnalyzer

      public TextAnalyzer()

  • Method Details

    • fileManager

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> fileManager()
      By using a Scanner object, it reads a HTML file, looks for the beginning of the poem, then reads all the words in the poem, ignores the HTML tags, and stops after the last word of the poem
      Returns:
      a list of strings with all the words in the poem
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file is not found based on the data provided
      java.util.NoSuchElementException - if the element being requested does not exist

    • removeAmpersand

      public static java.lang.String[] removeAmpersand​(java.lang.String initialStr)
      Takes the words that contains dashes, represented in HTML with an expression that include the ampersand. The dashes are then removed and two words are generated from the initial one
      Parameters:
      initialStr - the initial word that contains a dash, represented in HTML with an expression that includes the ampersand
      Returns:
      two strings representing the words generated after the dash is removed from the initial String

    • cleanArrayNoTags

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> cleanArrayNoTags​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> someArray)
      Removes the HTML tags from the file that is read within the TextAnalyzer class.
      Parameters:
      someArray - the array of Strings that represent words in the poem and also HTML tags
      Returns:
      an array of Strings that excludes HTML tags

    • trimPunctuation

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> trimPunctuation​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> beginingArray)
      As some of the words in the poem are ended with punctuation signs, this method removes all the final punctuation that exists at the end of any word that is in this situation
      Parameters:
      beginingArray - the initial Array of Strings that possibly includes words ended with punctuation signs
      Returns:
      an array of Strings where no words ends with punctuation signs

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      This is the main method of TextAnalyzer class that calls trimPunctuation() methods, creates an instance of the PairOfWordsAndOccurrences class, and sorts the pairs of words and occurrences by the occurrence in descendant order
      Parameters:
      args - array of Strings
      See Also:
      PairOfWordsAndOccurrences
